Delhi, India - Climate Chart
More Related Articles on PlanetWare.com
 Other highlights include several unique items, such as a collection of saloon cars belonging to the country's once powerful Maharajas, including the teak carriage of the Maharaja of Mysore, covered with ivory; the cabin of the Prince of Wales from 1876; and the carriage in which the ashes of Gandhi were carried after his assassination in 1948. Built in the mid-16th century by Haji Begum as a memorial to her husband by Humayun's senior widow, the tomb is surrounded by lush formal gardens and other tombs including Humayun's barber and the Tomb of Isa Khan (the architect of the Taj Mahal), a fine example of Lodi architecture and octagonal in shape.
 The former, inaugurated by the British in 1931 to serve as the imperial capital, is the nation's modern capital and seat of government, while Old Delhi is considered by many as the symbolic heart of the greater metropolitan area.
 The Indira Gandhi Memorial Museum
Another important politician-related attraction is the Indira Gandhi Memorial Museum, housed in the former residence of this much-revered woman (Indira was the daughter of India's first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, and although a friend of Mahatma Gandhi, was unrelated).

© 2024 Lonely Planet, a Red Ventures company. 18. Escape the crush at the Raj Ghat Gandhi Memorial
For respite from the chaos of the city streets, visit Gandhi's simple memorial in its tranquil gardens at Raj Ghat, and consider the humble lifestyle of the great Independence leader and the tragedy of his departure – nowhere else in Delhi is as peaceful as this.
19. You might also like: History, art and toilets: the best museums in DelhiThe Indian capital by night: the best bars and clubs in DelhiMeet the banker behind Delhi's favorite chocolate factory
This article was first published August 2019 and updated October 2021
Explore related stories
Astrotourism
Dec 27, 2023 • 8 min read
Spectacular things are happening in the skies all over the world in 2024. If possible, catch the Republic Day celebrations (January 26) here when the Prime Minister hoists the Tricolor from its resplendent ramparts, and browse the wares on sale in the Meena Bazar, once the exclusive domain of the ladies of the Mughal court.
 Watch the Changing of the Guard
A relatively unknown Delhi attraction, the Changing of the Guard takes place on the forecourt of the Rashtrapati Bhavan every Saturday morning.

activity_research_results.title: 9 best museums in Delhi-NCR | Condé Nast Traveller India
activity_research_results.content: The National Gallery of Modern Art (NGMA) is housed in the beautiful 1930s building known as Jaipur House in the leafy India Gate C-hexagon. This is the best place to appreciate up close works by contemporary and modern artists such as Raja Ravi Verma, the Tagore brothers, Amrita Sher-Gill, and post-independence bigwigs like MF Husain and FN Souza, among numerous others.

activity_recommendations.title: Visit the Sulabh International Museum of Toilets
activity_recommendations.description: A unique museum showcasing the global history of sanitation and toilets.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: Delving into the quirky and unique side of Delhi, this museum offers an intriguing perspective on human history and hygiene.

activity_recommendations.title: Explore the Indira Gandhi Memorial Museum
activity_recommendations.description: Dedicated to Indira Gandhi, this museum provides insights into her life through photographs, newspaper articles, and personal belongings.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: A politically significant site, it offers a comprehensive view into the life of one of India's most influential leaders.

activity_recommendations.title: Stroll through Lodhi Gardens
activity_recommendations.description: A sprawling garden with tombs dating back to the Sayyid and Lodhi dynasties.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: As a historical park, it provides both relaxation and a dive into Delhi's rich history.

activity_recommendations.title: Visit the National Museum
activity_recommendations.description: One of the largest museums in India, showcasing art and artifacts from pre-historic to modern times.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: For museum enthusiasts, this is a must-visit to experience India's vast cultural and historical wealth.

activity_recommendations.title: Shop at Khan Market
activity_recommendations.description: One of Delhi's most upscale markets, offering a variety of goods from books to high-end fashion.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: Perfect for indulging in some retail therapy and experiencing the shopping culture of Delhi.

activity_recommendations.title: Explore Dilli Haat
activity_recommendations.description: An open-air market offering traditional crafts, souvenirs, and regional food from across India.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: For an authentic local shopping experience, this market provides a cultural immersion with a variety of handicrafts.

activity_recommendations.title: Visit the National Gallery of Modern Art
activity_recommendations.description: A premier art gallery showcasing contemporary and modern art from India.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: For those interested in art, this gallery offers a deep dive into both historical and modern Indian art.

activity_recommendations.title: Relax at Nehru Park
activity_recommendations.description: A popular park in the heart of the city, known for its open spaces and cultural events.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: It’s an ideal spot to unwind and enjoy some green space amidst the bustling city.

activity_recommendations.title: Experience Raahgiri Day at Connaught Place
activity_recommendations.description: A social initiative featuring activities like cycling, yoga, and Bollywood dance every Sunday morning.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: A great way to start your day with physical activities and partake in a local social event.

activity_recommendations.title: Attend the Changing of the Guard at Rashtrapati Bhavan
activity_recommendations.description: A ceremonial event held every Saturday morning at the Presidential Palace.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: A lesser-known attraction that offers a glimpse into India's presidential traditions and protocols.
